panels.title: Total nodes in mesh

panels.description: Nodes that sent any packet in the last 30 minutes
panels.title: Active nodes in the last 30 minutes

panels.description:
How many nodes are unknown and how many are known.

The unknown are ones that are either NULL in their long name or "Unknown" in their value

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    COUNT(CASE WHEN long_name IS NULL OR long_name = 'Unknown' AND node_id != '0' THEN 1 END) AS "Unnamed",
    COUNT(CASE WHEN long_name IS NOT NULL AND long_name != 'Unknown' AND node_id != '0' THEN 1 END) AS "Named"
FROM
    node_details

panels.title: Nodes naming status

panels.description: Total packets sent in specified time range
panels.title: Total packets sent

panels.description: Shows the total data sent on the mesh in bytes in the last hour. This includes all types of packets.
panels.title: Data sent on mesh in last hour

panels.description: Shows the max recorded chanel utilization and the average

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
    AVG(dm.channel_utilization) OVER (PARTITION BY dm.node_id) AS "ChUtil",
    dm.time
FROM device_metrics AS dm 
JOIN node_details AS nd ON dm.node_id = nd.node_id
WHERE dm.node_id IN ($Nodes)
  AND dm.channel_utilization IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY dm.time;

panels.title: Channel Utilization (ChUtil)

panels.description:
This panel shows the percentage of airtime used for transmissions in the last hour. Airtime in LoRa networks represents the duration a device occupies the radio frequency channel to send data. It's a critical metric for:

Network capacity: Higher airtime usage indicates increased network load.

Regulatory compliance: Many regions limit the total airtime per device.

Battery life: More airtime generally means higher power consumption.

The data comes from Meshtastic packets, reflecting actual network usage. High percentages may suggest the need for optimization or capacity planning.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
    nd.long_name,
    dm.air_util_tx AS "AirUtilTX",
    dm.time
FROM device_metrics AS dm 
JOIN node_details AS nd ON dm.node_id = nd.node_id
WHERE dm.node_id IN ($Nodes)
  AND dm.air_util_tx IS NOT NULL
  AND dm.air_util_tx > -100
ORDER BY dm.time;

panels.title: Duty Cycle (AirUtilTX)

panels.description: Displays the nodes that utilize most of the channel (On average with at least 1 update every hour)

targets.expr:
topk(3,
  avg by (node_id, short_name, long_name) (
    avg_over_time(telemetry_app_channel_utilization{node_id=~"$Nodes"}[$__range]) > 0
    and
    timestamp(telemetry_app_channel_utilization{node_id=~"$Nodes"}) > time() - 3600
    and
    changes(telemetry_app_channel_utilization{node_id=~"$Nodes"}[3h]) > 0
  )
)

panels.title: Top channel utilizers

panels.description:

panels.title: Packet types for selected time

panels.description: How many hops are configured for each client
panels.title: The configured max hops for each client

panels.description: Graph that is built from Neighbor Info reports and shows the signal strenth for each line

targets.rawSql:
SELECT DISTINCT
    cd.node_id AS "id",
    cd.long_name AS "title",
    cd.hardware_model AS "detail__Hardware Detail",
    cd.role AS "detail__Client Role",
    cd.mqtt_status AS "detail__MQTT Status",
    cd.short_name AS "subtitle",
    CASE
        WHEN cd.mqtt_status = 'online' THEN '#2ECC71' -- Green for online
        WHEN cd.mqtt_status = 'offline' THEN '#E74C3C' -- Red for offline
        ELSE '#808080' -- Gray for none or any other status
    END AS "color"
FROM
    node_details cd
LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT node_id FROM node_neighbors
    UNION
    SELECT neighbor_id FROM node_neighbors
) nn ON cd.node_id = nn.node_id
WHERE nn.node_id IS NOT NULL

SELECT 
    CONCAT(neighbor_id, '_', node_id) AS id,
    neighbor_id AS "source",
    node_id AS "target",
    snr AS "mainstat",
    CASE
        WHEN snr < -13 THEN '#E74C3C'  -- Red for SNR < -13
        WHEN snr < -7 THEN '#F4D03F'   -- Yellow for -13 ≤ SNR < -7
        ELSE '#2ECC71'                 -- Green for SNR ≥ -7
    END AS "color",
    GREATEST(0.1, LEAST(2, 1 + ((snr + 13) / 10))) AS "thickness"
FROM 
    node_neighbors

panels.title: Node Graph

panels.description: Information stored on the Redis DB which includes "hard to get" information - that is needed to be gathered over time.
panels.title: General Information

panels.description: Displays the nodes on the map

targets.rawSql:
SELECT * 
FROM node_details 
WHERE longitude IS NOT NULL AND longitude IS NOT NULL

panels.title: Nodes map

list.definition:
SELECT 
  concat(long_name, ' (', node_id, ')') as __text, 
  node_id as __value 
FROM node_details 
ORDER BY long_name
list.label: Nodes
list.name: Nodes

  concat(long_name, ' (', node_id, ')') as __text, 
  node_id as __value 
FROM node_details 
ORDER BY long_name
